meanings.definition: The act of taking away or detracting from something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant detractions of his work made him feel unappreciated.
meanings.sent2: The detractions of the dishonest employee led to his dismissal.
meanings.sent3: The detractions of the noisy parrot were surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: The detractions of the storm on the beach left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The detractions of the faulty equipment caused delays in production.

meanings.definition: The act of belittling or disparaging someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His detractions of her appearance were hurtful and unnecessary.
meanings.sent2: The detractions of the rival company were aimed at tarnishing their reputation.
meanings.sent3: The detractions of the grumpy cat were surprisingly witty.
meanings.sent4: The detractions of the jealous classmate cut deeper than expected.
meanings.sent5: The detractions of the critic were harsh but not entirely unfounded.

meanings.definition: The state of being discredited or diminished in value.
meanings.sent1: The detractions on the antique vase lowered its selling price.
meanings.sent2: His detractions of the project caused it to lose funding.
meanings.sent3: The detractions of the old car turned out to be exaggerated.
meanings.sent4: The detractions on her character were proven false in court.
meanings.sent5: The detractions on the painting's authenticity cast doubt on its origin.
